header.title: The persistent cache under Apache Cocoon
header.abstract: This document explains how the persistent cache under Cocoon operates.

s1.title: Goal
s1.p: This document explains how the persistent cache under Cocoon operates.

s1.title: Normal filesystem persistence:
s1.p: When you configure this opportunity, then the Cocoon objects will be ordinarily serialized to a specified directory. This method is okay for a small number of objects and if your OS can handle long filenames. Some Windows OS have problems when the filenames are very long.

s1.title: Jisp based persistence:
s1.p: The aim of the Jisp based persistence is to provide a more scalable persistence. The objects are stored in an indexed file, which uses a B-Tree alghorithm to store the objects. This is a more elegant and fast solution, especially when you need to handle many objects.

s1.title: Configuration:
s1.p: Please refer to cocoon.xconf file for further configuration explanation.
